timeline.bodyText: This PR somehow changed the timing of events so much that the fromCache:false event is now delivered before hasPendingWrites:false. I am not 100% convinced that this is not due to a bug, but if I look at the test logs everything looks sane.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: This is the change from #1188
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: FYI: A lot of the diff in this file brings the test more in line with master.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText:
It seems like having overloads (or just a public interface) that accepts FieldValue/ObjectValue would make this code less cumbersome to deal with.
Then again, if this is the only caller, maybe this is better.
Just a thought; no action required.
timeline.author: wilhuff

replies.bodyText: This pattern is used in two places in the code and in a bunch of test cases in UserWriterTest. I added a helper to UserDataWriterTest, but kept the usages in the code the same.
replies.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: This code essentially duplicates Values.valueOf. Is there no way to unite these?
timeline.author: wilhuff

replies.bodyText: I added a TODO for now. I would like to remove the individual field value wrappers first.
replies.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText:
It seems like this would be cheaper if we iterated over the proto Value elements and compared for equality using ProtoValues directly.
Feel free to defer into another PR that address concerns like these.
timeline.author: wilhuff

replies.bodyText: Done. More cleanup and the removal of ArrayValue will come in a follow-up.
replies.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: If you pull the proto out of the value outside the loop you can use ProtoValues.equals here instead which avoids the reflective type checking and allocation inherent in FieldValue.valueOf.
timeline.author: wilhuff

replies.bodyText: I updated the callers of this method to do exactly that.
replies.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: Ideally I think we should avoid methods like these and just have callers operate on the protos or build methods on ArrayValue that hide that detail.
timeline.author: wilhuff

replies.bodyText: I removed contains() in this PR, but kept this method for now since the ReferenceValue equality is a bit trickier. I added a TODO to remove this in a follow up PR.
replies.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText:
It seems like the 2018 date should be preserved, since the the copyright should always reflect the first date of publication. If you want to also update this for the current date (since there's a major modification here), make this:
// Copyright 2018-2020 Google LLC
Leaving this in the prior state is also fine.
See go/copyright for more details.
timeline.author: wilhuff
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-// Copyright 2018 Google LLC
+// Copyright 2019 Google LLC

replies.bodyText: This got updated as I merge/moved files. Reverted this change.
replies.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: You can drop the this. here (and below).
timeline.author: wilhuff

timeline.bodyText: Shorten this to use the imported Value and MapValue? Here and below.
timeline.author: wilhuff

timeline.bodyText: It strikes me here that we're inconsistent about how we handle these singletons. We could have NullValue.NULL instead, right?
timeline.author: wilhuff

timeline.bodyText: Now that baseObject is a Builder, this assignment here seems duplicative. The builder only does return this for chaining, right?
timeline.author: wilhuff

replies.bodyText: Yes, this is not needed anymore. We also don't use chaining anywhere - I wonder if we should remove it from the Builder API.
replies.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: Use an early return to reduce nesting?
timeline.author: wilhuff

timeline.bodyText: hardAssert that isServerTimestamp(value)?
timeline.author: wilhuff

replies.bodyText: Done. Also made the constructor package-private.
replies.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: It seems like the other tests are using a single letter variable that's short for the type. Make this Timestamp t?
timeline.author: wilhuff
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -167,8 +179,8 @@ public void testConvertsTimestampValue() {
     for (Timestamp d : testCases) {

timeline.bodyText: Import FieldValue and shorten?
timeline.author: wilhuff

timeline.bodyText:
fooString isn't adding a whole lot of value here, and it's inconsistent with the other string literals here. Consider reverting that.
Also, why not pass the values as arguments to map? That seemed like a great way to explicitly compose expected values.
timeline.author: wilhuff

timeline.bodyText: FWIW, valueOf("a") seems cleaner than wrap("a").getProto().
timeline.author: wilhuff

replies.bodyText: Replaced this single occurrence with a call to the helper setField.
replies.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: We should add an overload for setField that allows map to work inline so that we don't have think about this distinction.
timeline.author: wilhuff

timeline.bodyText: List<FieldValue> still seems like "elements" more than "elementsProto": we're asking each element to get its underlying proto.
timeline.author: wilhuff

timeline.bodyText: Is it possible to make the array transform elements just a model.ArrayValue?
timeline.author: wilhuff

timeline.bodyText: Similarly: can we make transform results a model.ArrayValue so we don't have to convert?
timeline.author: wilhuff
